Name: Shingon Karuta
Description:
çœŸè¨€ã‚«ãƒ«ã‚¿ (Shingon Karuta) is a Japanese card game of Karuta, using Buddhist mantras (Shingon) and artwork.

In a karuta game, players try to snatch the matching card from the other player's tableau, or protect their own card by covering it first. Typically, a separate player acts as a Reader by reading out loud from a separate deck. Players then deduce from what is read which card on display is the target, and move swiftly.

In this game of Shingon Karuta, the designer aimed to improve the education of Buddhist iconography. There is a deck of Bodhisattva cards and a deck of Shingon cards.  A Bodhiattva is a person on the path to Buddhahood, and such people are widely depicted in temple artwork, in sculpture and painting. Shingon Buddhism is one of the main schools in Japan, and the Shingon deck has sections of mantras that relate to specific Bodhisattva images.

As the Shingon card is read out, each player tries to identify the matching Bodhisattva card and snatch it or keep it.

The game was originally published in 2017, but revised in 2019 to unify the artwork to one style. The designer realised that players could simply learn the deck by the different style of artworks, and not by learning the actual Bodhisattvas. By making all the art unified, the game becomes much harder.

In 2018, the designer published an explansion set of 10 more Bodhisattva cards and 10 matching Shingon cards. Players could just play with this expansion set alone. This deck was integrated into the 2019 edition too.

—user summary

Name: Up & Across
Description:
Up & Across is a two-player, abstract strategy board game on a 7×7 board.
Each player has a choice out of 2 actions. Move 2 towers or move your wizards.

Aim of the game is to bring your wizards to the other side of the board ending on your own towers. 
Wizards are only allowed to be moved one step up or one step down on the towers.
Towers with wizards on them can not be moved.

—user summary

Name: Anachrony: Infinity Box
Description:
Anachrony is a worker placement and tableau building game set in a foreboding future. As a leader of one of humanity's four ideological Paths, your goal is to prepare for an asteroid impact bound to happen over the course of the game, and become the dominant power on New Earth once the dust has settled. At your disposal are not only your loyal workers and high-tech Exosuits, but also the ability to open Time Rifts, implemented as an innovative game mechanism.

The Infinity Box includes every expansion and module released for Anachrony so far, plus the new Fractures of Time expansion and all stretch goals in an exclusive box with plastic trays to hold all content.

The Infinity Box is exclusive to Kickstarter.

INCLUDES:
Anachrony Base Game
Anachrony: Fractures of Time Expansion
Anachrony: Future Imperfect Expansion
Anachrony: Doomsday Module
Anachrony: Pioneers of New Earth Module
Anachrony: Guardians of the Council Module
36 large Exosuit Miniatures
Plastic Tray
Printed Plastic Warp Tiles
Art and Storybook
All Stretch Goals

—description from the publisher
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: Heavy Traffic
Description:
Heavy Traffic is a two-player, abstract strategy board game that represents choas in a logistic centre on a 8x8 board.

The aim of the game is to use the truck for transporting your load to a delivery point.

There are 3 starting conditions with all different pickup and delivery points.

A truck with load can move 1 step, a truck without load can move 2 steps. 
Also use the trucks wisely to block the other players trucks.

The winner of the game is the player who transport the load as first to the destination.

—user summary

Name: Stworze: Początek
Description:
The next expansion to the game Stworze. The expansion introduces new mechanics or new methods of finishing Missions. It also enables direct fights between Stworza and a new Stworze enters the fray: Grzybun.

—user summary

Name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition) – Beneath the Red Keep
Description:
Your exploration of King's Landing takes you to the heart of the city in Beneath the Red Keep, the fourth Chapter Pack in the "King's Landing" cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game!

As the sixth cycle of A Game of Thrones: The Card Game continues, you are free to explore the streets and alleys of the capital of the Seven Kingdoms without being bound to the timeline of A Song of Ice and Fire.

With new locations that help you stand ready against any unwanted surprises your enemy may have in store, this Chapter Pack explores every corner of the Red Keep from its towers to its dungeons, and at every turn, spies and assassins wait for the opportune moment to spring their traps on unsuspecting enemies. Complete with a new agenda that lets your deck draw from the shadowy power of any House, this pack encourages you to make the most of the shadows, spin your schemes, and claim the castle for your own!

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: A Game of Thrones – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – A Shadow in the East
Description:
Confront a dangerous cult in A Shadow in the East, the eighth deluxe expansion for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game! The power of Mordor stretches across the realm, darkening the hearts of those who fall under its influence and threatening the once-peaceful lands of RhuÌ‚n. Only Middle-earth's bravest heroes can hope to stand against the spread of evil when a band of desperate Dorwinions come to ask for aid. Your team of heroes will embark on a dangerous journey into darkness in three new quests that take you down the River Running, to the capital city of Dorwinion, and further into the Hills of RhuÌ‚n.

With new hero and player cards to further customize your adventures, this deluxe expansion kicks off the "Vengeance of Mordor" cycle with grand fanfare, introducing the game's first double-sided hero, as well as a new version of The One Ring and a new card type in the form of contracts. Assemble your Fellowship and prepare for a daring mission in the shadow of Mordor!

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: The Lord of the Rings – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: Space Infantry Resurgence Core Rules
Description:
Space Infantry Resurgence is a robust gaming system that features a unique solitaire game and has been further expanded to provide both co-op and two-player modes of play.  In Space Infantry Resurgence you command an elite squad of veteran Space Infantry soldiers taking on the daunting task of fighting against unknown alien foes, through challenging environments, using only the weapons and tools brought with you, or whatever can be scrounged along the way in order to achieve victory.

Space Infantry v2.0 rules are the latest set of guidelines and regulations for the game system written by Blackwell Hird and, Gottardo Zancani Lead Developers of Space Infantry Resurgence  Series.

These rules present the core rules for the game system. This new rule book has been designed to place all the rules in one book, making playing the game is easier and faster than ever.

—description from the publisher

Name: Return to Ravingspire
Description:
In the far future, an accident aboard the orbital research vessel Chronomega-1 causes the station to slice backward through the fabric of space-time, leaving loose threads in its wake. As the maelstrom fades and the threads pull together, knots are formed...

The haunted Tower of Ravingspire sits upon a prime nexus of this entropy, and its immortal lord has haunted the peoples of the Vorpal Realm for generations. The Dark Lord of the Tower was defeated long ago, but time doesn’t work like it should in the Tower, and those who should have succumbed to mortality… have come back.

Return to Ravingspire is a cooperative questing game for 1-4 players. Take on the roles of Heroes climbing the ever-shifting Tower to the Spire and face its Dark Master. But beware! For the Tower lies upon a nexus of space-time, and its portals may as easily lead to other dimensions as they will up the Tower.

—description from the publisher

Name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – Justice for Satsume
Description:
All eyes are on Otoson Uchi as the Hantei family line has been shaken like never before. While the Imperial City is the focal point for these dramatic events, strife infests Rokugan from all angles. The Emerald Empire breaks down in chaos — who will you support?

Step into the world of Rokugan with Justice for Satsume, the third Dynasty Pack in the "Inheritance" cycle for Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game! Justice for Satsume continues the themes of the "Inheritance" cycle, placing an emphasis on Courtiers and Bushi, introducing two new disguised characters ideal for surprising your opponent, and two Clan Champions!

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Star Wars: Destiny – Spark of Hope Booster Pack
Description:
Even in the darkest of times, the spark of hope can be found in the Star Wars galaxy, lit by those who dream of a better place. In the era of the Clone Wars, Jedi like Obi-Wan Kenobi fought against the darkness of the Separatist army. Jyn Erso and Luke Skywalker led a tiny band of Rebels against a Galactic Empire, and when the First Order rose to power, the Resistance stood up as the spark of hope that would burn it down.

Find your own path in Spark of Hope, a 160-card set of booster packs for Star Wars: Destiny! Spark of Hope continues the themes introduced in Convergence, with an emphasis on subtypes, downgrades, and new plots that change the way you construct your deck! Look for Red villain cards that empty your opponent's hand, a new set of moves and masteries for Blue heroes, new Bounty Hunters for Yellow villains, and more!

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Wars: Imperial Assault – Endor Defense Station Skirmish Map
Description:
The battle between the Rebel Alliance and the Galactic Empire spans countless worlds. Your adventures have taken you from the back alleys of Coruscant to the once-fertile fields of Lothal. Now it's time to venture to the forest moon of Endor for a new battle!

The Endor Defense Station Skirmish Map is a 26" x 26" slip-resistant mat for use in your Imperial Assault skirmish games, making setup quick and allowing you to jump right into the action with a pre-constructed map.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Wars: Legion – Imperial Shoretroopers Unit Expansion
Description:
Selected for rotational duty from exceptional Stormtrooper squads, Imperial Shoretroopers are trained not only in tropical environment operations, but also in entrenched warfare. Often assigned to important bases such as the Imperial security facility on Scarif, Shoretroopers use their expertise and equipment to counter Rebel ambushes and ensure Imperial secrets remain safe.

Within the Imperial Shoretroopers Unit Expansion, you'll find seven unique, unpainted Imperial Shoretrooper miniatures to add to your Star Wars: Legion collection. Five of these troopers are armed with E-22 blaster rifles while a Shoretrooper equipped with a T-21B targeting rifle is ready to deal extra damage from long range. But if you're truly looking to keep enemy units from escaping with sensitive information, a DF-90 Mortar Trooper can be added to your army as a detachment from the rest of your Shoretroopers. Rounding out this expansion are two unit cards,  five upgrade cards to fully kit out your Shoretroopers, and all the tokens you need to deploy them to any battle.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Wars: Legion – Dewback Rider Unit Expansion
Description:
The Empire often uses local creatures for its patrols, and in desert environments, Imperial troopers rely on dewbacks, mighty reptilian creatures that can survive extreme temperatures. Between the Sandtrooper rider's array of weapons and the powerful claws of their mount, this duo is a force to be reckoned with.

Within Star Wars: Legion – Dewback Rider Unit Expansion, you'll find an unpainted, beautifully-detailed Dewback miniature featuring a Sandtrooper rider with four distinct customization options: Your Dewback Rider can be built carrying their standard shock prod, or you can equip them with three different weapons. On top of the ability to customize the look of your Dewback Rider, this Unit Expansion gives you plenty of ways to tweak how this unit operates in the thick of battle. Six upgrade cards accompany the miniature, letting you modify its armament, training, or the comms systems it carries into battle. Rounding out this expansion are a unit card and all the tokens you need to deploy it as a support unit for your Imperial armies.

—description from the publisher

Name: Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game: The Weasley Twins
Description: Adds Fred and George Weasley to the Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game.

Name: Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game: Slytherin Students Pack
Description: Includes Draco Malfoy, Crabbe and Goyle.

Name: Show of Force
Description:
Show of Force (SOF) is a war themed competitive card game for players of all experience levels. SOF mixes the fun-for-everyone aspect of a party game, with the strategic gameplay of a trading card game.

To win you must kill your opponents by bring their Health Points to zero. This is done with the uses of 5 card types: Attack cards to do damage; Benefit cards to gain Health points; Utility cards to gain an edge; and Instant cards to be played any time for combos and defensives. Event cards are the 5th type and are randomly chosen and scattered throughout the main deck. When drawn they can be good or bad for players.

Strategy is very important because you can only play 1 card per turn, but at any moment an Event card can still ruin you plans. Gameplay types include free-for-all and team play, giving plenty of variety to a 88 card game.

—description from the designer

Name: Dinosauria
Description:
Dinosauria (Core) is a Solitaire 18-card microgame by Microgameo with 2-3 player expansions.

It is the year 3000. You are a Galactic Paleobiologist of the First Strata. The super-Earth planet Magnus-3 has been seeded with millions of living dinosaurs. Elite Paleobiologists such as yourself are privately invited to shepherd true, living dinosaurs.

Brief description of gameplay:


     Select Dino cards from the DNA Archive to revive
     Using the science of Vita, the game currency, return them to life
     Care for your brood by encouraging them to thrive and lay Eggs
     Watch those Eggs hatch as beautiful Babies
     Such caring wins you Universal Prestige
     But you’re not alone - Match wits with your Colleague, the game AI
     The one with the most Prestige wins


“Dinosauria is like if Wingspan and Splendor had a baby… big Jurrasic Babies.”

—description from the publisher

Name: World At War 85: Storming the Gap – Storm and Steel Second Wave
Description:
Storm and Steel Second Wave is a fast-paced action-packed expansion featuring West German forces defending their country against Czech and Soviet invaders. Basing these expansions on the action and forces from the novel, Storm and Steel Second Wave – the Final Line adds TWO NEW COUNTER SHEETS and THREE NEW MAPS to your World At War 85 forces.

Now you can fight using the platoons and batteries of the Czech Army as they charge into Southwest Germany heading for the Rhine and the French border. You will also find additional West German forces to try and slow or stop them! And you get TWO COMPLETE NATIONAL UNIT TABLES to go with these additional fighting forces, so you can design your own scenarios with them, or add them to units from the main game, Storming the Gap.  

The three new maps will give you the experience of fighting your WaW85 forces in the close-in terrain of southwestern Germany, south, and east of Regensburg: an entirely different battlefield “feel.” You will fight at knife-fight ranges on maps of a real section of the hilly and heavily forested areas there, and adapted specifically for World At War 85 play. The three SUMMER MAPS of the six maps herein, when configured in a specific pattern, display the actual fighting area surrounding Grafling, West Germany. The other six are WINTER VERSIONS, where any line of sight benefits of obscuring crops of cultivated terrain are gone and wilted, and so presents a whole different battle arena.  The maps have ever so slight adjustments that also make them GEOMORPHIC, and so fully compatible with any other map in the World At War 85 series of games. Just line up the short edge or long edge of any of these maps to any other map in the series to create your own Forward Edge of the Battle Area.

SIX SCENARIOS ARE INCLUDED, depicting actions described in or implied by the narrative in the Novel Storm and Steel. You can fight West German Captain Mohr’s 1st company of the 244th Mountain Tank Battalion yourself and see if you can do better than in the novel!

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: World At War 85 (Lock 'n Load Publishing)

Name: Runes & Regulations:  Nefarious Neighbor
Description:
The Nefarious Neighbor expansion opens the Runes & Regulations game up to 5-8 players, and it completely changes the dynamics. In this expansion, a dark sorcerer with horrifying powers (and intentions) moves into the neighborhood, forcing other players to decide whether to team up or continue to quibble. The Nefarious Neighbor steals Creatures from other players and performs dark rituals to mutate them into frightening beasts. That neighbor plays with their own standalone deck (included in the expansion pack) which includes Corrupted Creatures, Curses, and Dark Runes.

The Nefarious Neighbor’s powers are so immense that their Corrupted Creatures cannot be destroyed, hexed, or stolen; however, the expansion also includes cards to shuffle into the Main Deck to help other players fight back and thwart that neighbor’s villainous plans.

One of the most interesting parts of the Nefarious Neighbor expansion is the introduction of player role cards. In addition to the Nefarious Neighbor, other players will have the opportunity to take on a new role (in secret). These roles provide you with a second win condition that nobody else knows about, giving you the opportunity to surprise your neighbors with an unexpected victory. Since only the Nefarious Neighbor’s role is known, each other player around the table is left to wonder what role their opponents might secretly be playing. These roles include things like Mr. Griffin (who wins if they successfully summons 3 Griffins), the Henchman (who wins if the Nefarious Neighbor wins and Henchman has no creatures on their Lawn), and the Humane Sorcerer (who wins by successfully saving a Stray Dog or Alley Cat).

Runes & Regulations by itself is a super fun and interactive game, and we designed it to stand entirely alone. I say this because the game really works without the expansion, and we didn’t even start working on the expansion until we had the original game completely finished and play tested. Getting to add on this expansion was a dream, though, and getting the opportunity to actually make it a reality because of the support so far on this project is incredibly exciting. The introduction of this expansion just makes the game so much more dynamic (and really creates two different games).

—description from the designer

Name: Dilemmi
Description:
Variant on the classical "Vocabulary game" made in collaboration with the Italian dictionary publisher Zanichelli.

The players take turns until a player reaches the end of the point track. At each player's turn, other players pick a single card from the deck. Each card report a "difficult" word, the correct definition and some incorrect definitions. According to secret roles, each player must:

     the "sage" must read the correct definition;
     the "charlatans" must read an uncorrect definition;
     the "great cyaltron" must totally invent a new definition on his own.


The current player must guess the sage and the great cyaltron. If he guess correctly, he scores points.
Other players score if they are indicated as sage, if the great cyaltron is not identified, etc.

—user summary

Name: Blutube
Description:
In Blutube - chi porta l'acqua in casa ("Who bring water in houses") players must compete in order to construct the most efficient city.
This game is a promo collaboration between the water provider GEAL, the City of Lucca, Lucca Crea srl and Ludoteca Lucchese.
The game was made with the support of Red Glove developers.

The game is played on a grid surrounded by bullding tiles. At his turn, each player may place tiles on the grid in order to build a pipe network and bring water to buildings. The buildings may be upgraded from a not sustenaible to a susteinable version: the player that upgrades a building scores points if the pipe network reaches that building.

Name: Exogenesis
Description:
Freezing cryogel cables hiss as they retract into the sides of your cryopod. As you wake with a chemical-induced headache, the lid of your pod pops open letting warm and oddly humid air rushing into your nose. You smell... foliage?

A holoscreen blinkers on above your face, shining purple data scrolling down, making you flinch as the light pierces your still blurred vision. Blinking away gel, you read the info...

342 years!!? You punch the screen with your fingers requesting a recalc but the data remains the same. You've been locked in cryo for 342years! And what are these bizarre objects apparently arranged in orbit around this alien planet?

Genesis (noun: the origin or beginning of something) and
Exo (prefix: outside, alien)

Exogenesis is a survival exploration game of the 4X style. The Exosurvey ship Cygnus X2 on route to Proxima Centauri is subverted by an alien digital virus that causes the ship to crash on an alien world. As surviving officers onboard, the players must work together to survive, then to explore and lastly to decide whether to repair the ship and leave or uncover the mystery that brought them to this world. Exogenesis is a tough game with powerful protagonists. Failure to prioritise and work diplomatically with each other will lead to failure, and death for the crew. You have been warned.

—description from the publisher

Name: Color Line
Description: A game involving action and speed. Ring the doorbell if you want the ball that has come out of the ball holder, be the first to complete your colour line, have a good think about if you want the ball as you will lose one of the ones you already got if you get it wrong.

Name: New York Slice: Lick a Slice
Description:
Lick a Slice* - Place immediately on one collected slice of pizza. +1 pt for each of your collected slices of that type.

Given out as part of the SOCMOM promo club.

Name: Frank Buck's Bring 'Em Back Alive Game
Description:
Frank Buck was a well-known big game trapper who wrote a 1930 book, Bring 'Em Back Alive. In this game there are twelve books of three cards. Each book represents an animal that Fran Buck has brought back alive from the jungles or a scene illustrating adventures on his expeditions. The books are made by fitting the three cards together in the proper way to form a complete picture. The  center card of each book has the name of the book at the top and a red number. The other two cards of each book have some descriptive or leading phrase that gives a clue to its proper book without revealing the name.

Players draw a card to determine the dealer. The higher number deals. Players are dealt three cards face up. The remaining cards are placed face down in the center. The dealer plays first. He looks over all the cards to determine whether or not a book may be made up from the cards showing. If  the dealed can make up a book, he selects the proper cards and places them in front of him. His turn is complete and play passes to the player on his left. If the dealer can not make up a book, he draws one card from the top of the center pile and tries to make up a book. If successful, he places the book in front of him. If unsuccessful in making up a book, the card drawn is discarded face up.  In either case his turn ends and play passes to the left. The player to the left then has the same option as the dealer plus he may use the card which has been discarded. The following general rules apply. A player may get only one book in a turn. After the three original cards a player does not replace any cards which may be drawn from his hand. If a player discards the third card of any book (not realizing that it made a book), any other player may call the name of the animal and pick up the book with out interfering with his turn. When the cards in the pack have all been drawn the discard pile is turned over and used again.

—user summary

Name: ROKU
Description:
This is a captivating game based on quick reaction and attention where everything revolves around number six. Instantly count colors on cards, seize cards of other players, roll the dice most accurately! Get the biggest score you can and become the best in this colorful folly!

ROKU is an easy to master game for all kinds of players!

—description from the publisher

Name: Protostar
Description:
Its rough out on the rim. It’s all you can do to put together enough scratch to keep your boat in the air and a gun out of your face.  You take what jobs you can get and don’t ask too many questions about the who or the what. Some days I feel like an inter system taxicab. The better you do, the more influence you get, and that’s worth more than nearly any of the cargo you might be hauling. Build enough of it and enough cash, and you might be able to convince the Central Authority to grant you access to the warp gate to the inner systems. Where life just might be a little bit easier. Maybe.

Protostar s a competitive SciFi Bounty Hunting Game for 1-5 players. Each turn, players pick a different rim system to jump to with their NavCom and explode through the galaxy to accumulate the most achievements to leave this all behind.

Players can route power from their ships to different systems, as well as increase their Boost which defines who gets to take their turn first, and gives more flexibility in battle.

Once players arrive, if they have the cash or the cargo, they may choose from a plethora of actions to help them achieve their goals.


     Buy Goods
     Sell Goods
     Salvage a card (to make money)
     Swap a card (to draw a new cord)
     Upgrade their ships different systems
     Complete a Bounty (to gain Achievements)
     Wipe a Bounty off the Board
     Fire on another player in their system.
     Repair their Hull
     Reload their Weapons
     Refuel their Engines


If a player is fired on and their shields are brought below 0, they lose some of their resources to the attacking player. But watch out for counter attacks. Its important do pay attention to what system your opponents might be going to, in order to either disrupt their plans, or avoid their fire.

Name: FLIP
Description:
FLIP is a simple checker-like game for two players. The game includes a game board like a checker board with a red borderline around one-half and a blue borderline around the other half. There are 24 special chips resembling poker chips that are red on one side and blue on the other. Each player places 12 chips in two rows of six on the first and second row of his side of the board leaving a vacant square to the left and to the right. The player on the red side places chips red side up. The player on the blue side places chips blue side up.

The players' objective is to move their chips across the board to occupy the same positions as the opponent's starting chips. Each turn a player may move one chip one space to an empty square in any direction. A player may also jump an opponent's chip that is adjacent provided there is an empty square behind the chip. Similar to a king in checkers, multiple jumps may be made in a single turn in any direction including diagonally. A player may never jump his own chip. Whenever a diagonal jump is made, the player flips the opponent's chip over to his color and this becomes his chip. Reducing the opponent's number of chips to less than 12 prevents the opponent from winning until he acquires 12 chips again.

—user summary

Name: Tom & Jerry: So ein Käse
Description:
Funny, colorful and full of happy actions. That's the way Tom and Jerry are known on TV, and so is this game. 2-4 players try to get a complete cheese with their mice - but that's not so easy. Because, as much as one tries to get on the auspicious cheeses fields - the evil teammates always push you back to where you do not want. And turning on the lucky clock usually does not help. And if you almost believe in your destination, you will be stealing another piece of your own cheese. There is only one thing: Pay back with the same coin...

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Ricochet: The New Casino Game
Description:
This is a dice game for players who enjoy the hazards of the casino. All players start with 20 chips. The game board is divided into four sections. Each section has 5 identical lanes lead from START to a finish on a GREEN Square. Each player chooses one section and places five chips on the squares marked "START". Each player rolls the pair of dice. High number starts and play continues clockwise.

The game is divided into matches. A match is won by the first player to fill a GREEN square. The chips are moved from START to the GREEN area in their lane according to the roll of the dice. One chip can be moved the total of the dice or each die can be used separately to move two chips. A seven must be split except when chips are in the PURPLE area (see next paragraph). On a roll of doubles the player may move or take the POT if there are any chips in the POT (See RED in next paragraph). To "Ricochet" means to reverse direction while moving one chip. In order to land in the GREEN the count must be exact. If the roll would take the chip beyond the double line, the chip can be reversed at the double line. The winner of a match takes all the chips in play from all players except those chips on START or GREEN. The game is over when one player has filled all five of his GREEN squares. The game winner takes all the chips in play except those on START. The ultimate winner is the player with the most chips.

Each section contains areas of colored squares. A chip cannot remain in the RED area. It must be put in the POT. The WHITE area is safe. Chips may remain in WHITE and be moved when the player wishes. A chip in the BLUE area is safe until another player places a chip in the BLUE. The first player must then surrender his chip to that player. A chip in the PURPLE area must move before a chip in the WHITE, BLUE or START. If there is more than one chip in the PURPLE, the one nearest the GREEN must move first. Chips in PURPLE must use the total on the dice to move one chip. A chip in the ORANGE area is lost and remains frozen until the match is over.

Name: Battling Star-Ships
Description:
"Starships battle for the survival of the universe!"

In this dexterity game, two players sit on opposite sides of a large "space wheel".  The space wheel is spun with two starship pucks on it.  The players control sliding "command modules" and try to keep the starship of their color in play while allowing the opposing starship to fall off.

Name: Marathon Game
Description:
Players draw a running shoe as a token to move on the board and place them on START. Game cards are shuffled and placed face down on the designated space. The player with the Number 1 shoe draws the top game card and follows the instructions on the card for movement. The card is then placed on the designated discard space. Players continue to draw cards in turn until the cards are exhausted. The cards are re-shuffled and placed face down again. Play continues until all players have passed the through the finish chute.

When a player is instructed to go to the Sporting Goods Store, Rest Stop, etc. they lose a turn then discard the card. After loss of turn the player moves back onto the course.

The game board track is littered with information about runners, metabolic processes, metric conversions. running statistics and historical notes.

—user summary

Name: Dogs of the Galaxies
Description:
Dogs of the Galaxies is a card game for people not embarrassed making funny faces, uttering weird words or barking “Woof”, “Woof”, while wagging the tail.  Players take turns drawing cards and describing the dogs in them; for example, what the dog looks like, what pranks it just finished pulling, or what trick it has up its sleeves - practically any way the player wants to describe the dog. Card drawer also mimics the facial expression of the dog described.

Others then compete to outdo each other by coming up with the weirdest names, captions or memes for the dogs described and, sometimes, the sounds the dogs make. The player with the weirdest name, or sound, wins the point(s) for the round. The first to get 10 points wins the game.

The player with the least point(s) wags his or her tail while barking “woof”, “woof” like a dog.

—description from the publisher

Name: Nightmare On Production Street
Description:
Do you and your colleagues dare to take a journey into the frightening depths of a turnkey manufacturing project where anything and everything can go wrong? the objective is to travel counterclockwise around the gamer board by rolling the pair of dice, moving forwards or backwards as the squares indicate and by moving as the "Now What" and "Surprise" cards indicate.

Players place their tokens on the "Start Here" space. Each player rolls the dice and high roll goes first. Subsequent turns proceed clockwise. On a turn, the player rolls the dice and moves exactly that number of spaces to land on a space. The player must follow the directions on the space to move further, lose turns, draw a Surprise card or draw a What Now card. If drawing a card, follow its instructions. The turn then ends unless the player rolled doubles in which case the player rolls again.

The game can be won in three ways. First, a players can win by landing on the space that says "Your Turnkey Got Your Product Out. You're a Winner". If players overshoot the space, they continue around the board again. Second, players can agree to a time limit and the player that has traveled around the board the most times wins. There are scores sheet to keep track of progress. Third, there is a four piece visual made up of cards from the two card decks. If a player gets the four cards to complete the visual, they win.

—user summary

Name: Slamorama
Description:
SLAMORAMA! is a crazy and I mean crazy wrestling card game that will engage your full mental capacity as much as it will tickle your funny bone. Two to four players can brawl in this mental slap-stick game as they pit their moves against each other. You start out by picking one of four wacky wrestlers; "Glittersaurus Wrecks", "Mountain Man Rick", "El Alacran", or "The She-E-O" with their arsenal of insane moves to take out their opponents. Whoever wins the most cards wins the game and you do that by collecting the most tricks. (Publisher Description)

Slamorama is a 2-4 player wrestling card game from Binary Cocoa! Players all play their best moves against each other to win rounds, and whoever wins the most rounds by the time the cards are gone wins the game!

How to play:
1. Each player is given a deck of 13 cards that consists of wrestling moves like punches or slaps or suplexes. 1 is the strongest "move" card, while 7 is the weakest.

2. Players then count to three and throw down what they think will be the strongest move, and whoever that is wins the round! On a tie players throw down an additional card until someone finally wins. No one wins the round if the tie occurs on the last round.

3. Rounds go until all players decks are empty, and whoever wins the most rounds wins!

Special Features:
1. Each wrestler has a signature move that fits their persona. For example. Mountain Man Rick's Special move is the Salmon Slam. He literally picks people up and swings them around like a bear on the Snake River. Glittersaurus Wrecks special move is the rise and shine. She will lift you up just to bring you down. Very down.

2. The game allows for future expansions that will provide more wrestlers! We are planning on calling this first edition the "Red Deck", and (pending successful funding) we will be coming out with a "Green Deck". The Green Deck will have all new wrestlers so that you can combine decks and have up to 8 players in a game.

Alternate Game Modes:
In a standard game of Slamorama each player gets a deck of 13 cards and can have 4 in their hand that they can look at. Each full deck of Slamorama comes with two additional gameplay modes that include the following:

Full Deck Mode - Where you have all 13 cards in your hand and can look at them. Saves time from having to draw cards. Gives more "tactical advantage".

Tag Team Mode - Players choose a partner and play their cards together against opponents to win rounds! They cannot look at or tell each other what they are going to throw down however. Fun with bigger groups!

Game Contents:
52 cards (13 for each wrestler)

3 rule cards (each with a unique way of playing the game)

1 tuck box to hold the cards.

Name: Shodo
Description:
Shodo is the name given to Japanese calligraphy, considered by many people a true art, quite difficult to be perfected. Shodo art learners must have discipline and observe the techniques in each lesson taught by their master. Therefore, in this game, each player is an apprentice of this art, and therefore must execute the lessons passed by his master, joining the pieces that contain traces of traces, forming the calligraphic drawings required by one of the lessons.

Each player, on his turn, must manage his amount of paint, produced in his Suzuri, which will serve to acquire new pieces of strokes that complete his calligraphic designs or start new ones. The available pieces are renewed on the table as the players use them. Calligraphic drawing lesson cards are arranged randomly with each game, and players must observe the strategy of the other players to try to complete the lessons before the others, which will give them more points.

Completing a calligraphic drawing may not be as simple as doing so requires completing all the strokes already started. Once a drawing is completed and is also compatible with one of the available lessons (requirements may consist of the number of strokes, the shape of the drawing, or even the level of detail), the player may place one of his markers in that lesson. The first to place, in addition to receiving more points, make it impossible for the latter to place markers in the lessons.

Once all the lessons have been completed by at least one person, the game will be over, and it will be the winner who made the most points, obtained through the complexity of their calligraphic designs and the accomplishment of the lessons.

—description from the designer

Name: Estates
Description:
The first player to accomplish the following four conditions wins the game: 1) Has purchased one of the four estates, 2) Does not owe money to the bank, 3) Has $5,000 in play money and 4) Has his playing piece at home on his estate.

Each player has four plastic pieces of their color. The Home Marker, a large flat piece, is placed over the player's apartment, townhouse or estate to show which is his home. One of the three long pieces is placed on the Salary Record Board, one on the Rent and Salary Board and one on the Home Marker. The Direction Cards are placed on the board face down. Each player is given $500 and someone is designated as the banker. Each player rolls the die and high player starts. Each player in turn selects an apartment or house and places the Home Marker with the long piece atop on it and pays the bank the rent or lease. each player in turn takes the long piece from atop the Home Marker and places it in the yellow circle marked " Downtown and rolls the die. If a 5 or 6 is rolled the player draws a Direction card and follows the instructions which may mean moving the piece to a specific place and paying an amount to the bank. If a 1, 2 or 4 is rolled, the player moves his playing piece in any direction along the marked street one red dot for each count. The objective is to get the playing piece back to the Home Marker to increase salary. Salaries are collected to amass the funds to purchase the estate and liquidate bank debts.

—user summary

Name: Wreck Raiders: Kickstarter Edition
Description:
The Kickstarter edition contains several expansions that are not included in the retail edition, but will be available separately though in limited quantities.

About the game:
Plunge into the glittering sea to recover exotic treasures from a seafloor overflowing with pirate shipwrecks. Send your divers to the deep, but be careful; moving too close to other divers lets them get in on the haul too! Gather lost loot and beached baubles to assemble museum exhibits and construct eye-popping aquariums... but don't forget to save the best bits for your personal collection!

Wreck Raiders is an innovative dice-drafting worker placement system. Choose a die from the pool, then send one of your divers to any spot on the board with that number. But be warned: the spot you choose will help any diver in the spots next to you, whether they’re friendly or not. Will you risk letting a rival in on your haul to get that treasure you want, or can you find a way to grab yourself some extra loot?

Display your treasures to build museum exhibits, or send them to your vault for huge scoring opportunities... Don’t forget to visit the beach nearby to gather washed-up baubles and spend them to build awesome aquariums. (All sea creatures are treated ethically and released into the wild; also, they are cardboard tiles.)

When the game ends, you’ll earn coins for your exhibits, your vault, and your aquariums. The player with the most coins wins!

Name: Dice Settlers: Merchant Routes Promo Card
Description:
This promo was originally available in the Inuit: The Snow Folk box and later as part of the Promo Paradise 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

Promo consists of 1 Technology card with a green seal.

You need 2 Lanterns and presence on a Hills (brown) territory to research the Technology.

Benefit: When trading, also gain 1 tent from the general supply.

Name: Jazz Nights 54
Description:
Today, fame can come swiftly on the heels of a Top Twenty record, but there was a time when musicians had to prove themselves to other musicians in cutting sessions, jamming through the nights.

You are one of the, hard working, hot playing, jazz musicians, the cool cats, playing on the street corner, plinking in the piano bar, playing at that jazz café, singing in the studio, jamming at the club, drumming away that solo performance, on the stage, in the music hall, cutting sessions and winning the nights.

Jazz Nights is the 54 cards jazz-themed card game, where you stack cards and make patterns. You stack the cards at a personal tableau, which score you points at the end of sessions. The player with the highest point total of a session cuts the session. Be the first to cut three sessions and win the whole game.

Now it ain't the melody and it ain't the music, there is something else that makes the cuts complete. Gather your ensemble, choose the best location, gather the crowd, do that solo. Do the best performance at the right place. Activate your performers. Look for sets of treys. Give that rhythm everything, everything you got doo aah, dooo ah, doo ah, doo aaaah …

Gameplay

Each session one at the time, beginning with the player to the left of the dealer the players will place cards face up in front of them. You are building your own tableau of the jazz night for the current session. This tableau of stacked cards will at the end of this session be how you score. You must stack the cards as you play, cover parts of cards lain or the card you are placing. You may slide the new card under previous lain cards.

You score, by forming matched sets consisting of groups of three or more of a kind, of items, numbers, locations and musicians, or by building ensembles of three or more different musicians, or by building up a scoring crowd with sequences of coloured squares of your highest ranking location.

—description from the designer

Name: Eat It, Drink It, Smoke It, Do It
Description:
The game comes with a playing board and 200 cards, each with an item on one side. On her turn, a player guesses whether the item is for eating, drinking, smoking, or doing. The other side of the card indicates the number of spaces that the player moves her piece for the answer that she gave. Some items will have multiple possible answers, with different distances to move for each answer. Players take turns until someone reaches the finish line on the board.

—user summary

Name: Flip Words
Description: Flip Words is a two-player game that is played on a crossword grid, much like Scrabble. One player uses the yellow side of the tiles; the other player uses the white side. Players take turns adding words to the board in Scrabble fashion. Whenever the active player adds to an opponent's word, the active player flips the tiles in that word to his color. When all the tiles have been played, the player with the most tiles on the board in his color wins.

Name: Fossil Wars Dinosaurs
Description:
There's a central deck of cards from which players dig fossils. Most of these cards are dinosaur fossils. Some of these are too big and hence broken into 2 or 3 parts. On each fossil card, you'd find three main attributes of that dinosaur - it's type, time period and region. It also has a face value assigned on the top right corner. Players dig fossils from the central deck and exhibit their finds in different sections as per their type, time period or region. A section with at least 2 dinosaurs is considered complete. While digging 1 card is free, players can pay and dig more in the same turn. For this, they may gather money by selling fossils that they may not use to the market. Other players may also find what they need in the market and can buy from there as well. If a player completes 3 different sections or exhibits 5 dinosaurs within 1 section, the game ends. To determine the winner, all players calculate the total value of their exhibited fossils plus any remaining cash plus bonus points for the diversity of their collections.

—description from the publisher

Name: GO! Music
Description: This is an educational game that features a deck of cards with musical notes and intervals. Instructions are included for riffs on children's games such as Go Fish! and Egyptian Rat Screw. For instance, in GO! Chromatic (the Go Fish! variant) players take turns asking the other players for matching cards, e.g., C# will match a Dflat.

Name: Libretto
Description:
One player plays the yellow letter tiles; the other player plays the blue letter tiles. On his turn, a player creates a word with his tiles and places it on a 16X16 grid. The object of the game for each player is to connect with a series of words the sides of the board that match that player's tile colors and, of course, to block the other player, who is trying to do the same thing with his tiles. The first player to connect his sides of the board is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Stanford
Description:
A trick-taking game based upon Philip Zimbardo's 1971 Stanford Prison Experiment.  The games' cards represent inmates, guards, warnings resulting from audits of the experiment, and the guards' "curriculum".

Cards played to the trick may affect an inmates ego or body.  At the end of a round it is possible for an inmates' ego to reach 0, meaning their "education" is complete.  If an inmates body reaches 0, they are considered to have died and an audit is initiated.  Warnings will be issued for various curriculum cards which were played.

At the end of the game, the winner will be the player who scored the most points by completing the "education" of inmates.

—user summary

Name: FINAL BURGER -LAST ORDER-
Description: A trick-taking game, with bidding, where the cards earned from a trick are used to form hamburgers.  The cards are round with a bun shown on the back. The suits are hamburger ingredients, such as a burger, lettuce, tomato, egg, cheese, etc.  The pickle and french fry suits act as trump.

Name: Alexander Battle Module: The Battle of the Hellespont, 321 BC
Description:
The Battle of the Hellespont, 321 BC, a Diadochoi battle between Eumenes and Crateris.

Also includes setup instructions and rules for Simple GBOH.

C3i #30 Scenario published by C3i Magazine/RBM Studio, 2016.
Families: History: Wars of the Diadochi and Syrian Wars
Series: Great Battles of History (GMT Games)

Name: INFO-MANIA
Description:
INFO-MANIA is a challenging word game for any number of players. Each player is in a race against the clock and all other players to think of words in a particular category and starting with a selected set of letters of the alphabet. The player with the highest score wins.

Each player is given a score sheet and pencil. The decks of alphabet cards and category cards are shuffled. One player selects five alphabet cards at random and players copy these letters on their score sheets. One player draws a category card at random and players enter this on their score sheets. The timer is set and play begins.

Players write down words that apply to the category and whose last or major name begins with each of the selected letters. When time runs out each discloses the name he has written under each of the five letters. If only one player used a particular name, he scores 3 points. If two players use the same name, they score 2 points. If three or more players use the same name, they score 1 point. If a player did not write down a name for a letter, they do not score a point. After the first category is completed, the procedure is repeated until five different categories have been played. The player with the highest total points over all five categories is the winner.

—user summary

Name: NIWI
Description:
NIWI is similar in scoring to the game "The First 5,000" but it involves movement on a game board where a player may land their piece on a space occupied by an opponent's piece sending the opponent's piece backward on the board and reducing the opponent's score.

The object of the game is to achieve the highest score over 5,000 by throwing scoring combinations of six dice. Players move playing pieces counter-clockwise around the numbered board to record their score. The scoring dice are: a 5 equals 50 points, a 1 equals 100 points, any 3 of a kind equals 100 times the 3-of-a-kind number. A roll of six consecutively numbered dice (a straight) on one roll equals 1500 points. A minimum of 500 points in a turn is required to get on the board. A minimum of 300 points in a turn is required to advance on the board. As long as a player rolls at least one scoring die, the player may choose to roll again to try to increase their score for that turn. The scoring dice are set aside and the non-scoring dice are picked up and rolled again. Any roll with no scoring dice ends the player's turn and no points are scored. A player may end their turn after any scoring roll and keep the points accumulated for that turn with one exception. If all six dice are scoring dice either in one roll or in a combination of rolls, the player must roll again. After the first player has scored 5000 points the other players have one last chance to outscore that player. The highest score over 5000 wins.

A player may NIWI an opponent by rolling a score which lands them on the same space as an opponent in front of them. That opponent must then retreat their piece to the previous NIWI corner of the board and their point count is reduced to that of the first scoring space preceding that NIWI corner. Also, the opponent must roll a minimum of 500 points to proceed on the board their next turn.

—user summary

Name: Donning the Purple: Votes & Virtue expansion
Description:
Votes & Virtue is an expansion to Donning the purple and includes lots of new content that will create new headaches to the ruling emperor.


     A new role, called the General, with a unique player mat. If he becomes to popular among the legions they will proclaim him as the new emperor.
     A 4th player that starts the game as the General.
     A senate phase. Where all players uses their senators to vote over important things that affect the empire.
     An extra player mat for the heir with a unique action.
     Lots of new cards


—description from the publisher

Name: Electronic Name That Tune
Description:
This entertaining electronic game plays dozens of songs from its computer memory and has exciting lights and sounds that tell you when you win and when you lose.

The object of the game is to win the most money by correctly identifying the mystery tunes. Rach player starts with $5,000. Turn on the game by pressing START and a random dollar value will appear on the LED display for the mystery song chosen from computer memory. Each player deposits that amount into the JACKPOT. Players then bid the number of notes they need to name the tune until all agree that the lowest bidder may proceed. The low bidder then presses the corresponding BID-A-NOTE BUTTON for his bid. The game will play that many notes of the song and the bidder has five seconds to name that tune and press the PLAY BUTTON.(If no guess is made, the "YOU LOSE" tune plays, the player loses his money and is out of the round.) The game then plays then song from beginning to end. If the player is correct, he collects the money from the JACKPOT and a new round begins. If another player believes the guess was incorrect, he may press the CHALLENGE BUTTON during the playback of the song. The playback of the song will stop and the challenger has five seconds to guess the name of the song and press the play button. Other players may challenge the subsequent guess and so on. If the players cannot agree on the name of the song, the money remains in the JACKPOT for the next round of play. The winner is the player with the most money when the when it it is agreed to end the game.

The game includes a variation called "Stop the Music" and a bonus game called "Follow Me". A list of the pre-stored songs is included. The games also allows the input of any song into the computer memory for one round of play.

Name: On Mars: Beacon Promo Card
Description:
First offered as a bonus for retail backers of the Kickstarter. Now included as part of the expansion "On Mars: Alien Invasion".

Later available during the Game Boy Geek Season 10 Kickstarter campaign.

Name: GET CONNECT
Description:
An abstract game for 2-4 players where the players move a block through a hex-lattice collecting different letters of the English alphabet.  The collected letters are placed on the player's "Alphabetboard" and players earn points for collecting consecutive letters.

The @ piece acts as a wild card, N and Z have some special interactions based upon their visual similarity, and some vertices let a player teleport the pawn.

—user summary

Name: Tiddle Poker
Description:
Each player takes a set of seven winks and a sqidger (the large disc that flips the winks) of a unique color. Each player also gets a wooden block with a felt surface to use as a place from which to launch one’s own winks. The players’ target is a wooden game board with a nine by six grid with a standard deck of playing cards (with jokers) painted on it.

The players decide which card game they wish to play (the rules give instructions for Draw Poker, Five Card Stud Poker, Seven Card Stud Poker, Blackjack and Beginner Flip Hi, an original game). Each player places one’s own block six inches away from the game board and play.

—user summary

Name: The Wand Chronicles
Description:
Follows successful publication of a book trilogy of the same name.
2 games in one:
 Game one: 
on the Elvish dimension of Laniakeea, players seek to recover the wand, Elvina, from the Sola Tree using spells and magic.

General Playing cards are numbered and include pick up forfeit cards (Either positive moves from Elfistra the Sorceress, or minus moves from the evil Rand Raneth).

On the roll of a dice, the highest number goes first and chooses which character they wish to represent. These are small standalone cards in plastic holders. Every other player then chooses their character. 
The game then continues by the turning of the general playing cards and no dice. Spell cards are included, including the VAMABACK card which means the player that drew it, can choose an opponent and move them back to their home portal.There are a number of magical spell cards that create tension among all players.

The winner is the first player to collect Elvina the wand and game one ends here. Everyone gains points

Finish with a winner there or flip board over for continuation of the adventure by playing the 2nd game.

Game 2:

As a team, it is the quest of every player, including the winner from game one who has Elvina, to find and destroy the dark Lord Morg Spear'Nd in the Volcanic dimension of Pyramordial.

Movement around game board 2 is by the rolling of dice

Along the way there are lightning bolts, on which you can travel up, or dragon tongues, in which you have to travel down. There are also blue squares, where you collect positive points, and red squares where you would collect negative points. All points are noted on pads that each player has.

Every player has to reach the volcanic cave where Morg Spear'Nd is hiding. The player who holds the wand Elvina, then issues the destruction spell and Morg Spear'Nd is destroyed, and the invasion of the peaceful Elvish dimension of Laniakeea (Game board side 1) by Morg Spear'Nd is stopped. All points are added up, and only then is the overall winner of both games declared.

—description from the designer

Name: Pentaurus: Black Hole
Description:
Pentaurus: Black Hole adds new components to Pentaurus Duel to get a completely different game. Collect the galaxy's pentanium before the black hole swallows it all, but watch out for enemy fleets.

The playable area is made up of 25 cards in a 5x5 matrix with the black hole card in the center. Players enter the area from one of its sides and travel jumping from planet to planet collecting pentanium and fighting competing factions before the 10th turn when the black hole swallows the planets and the spaceships around it.

The game is designed for 2-5 players, who will explore the galaxy Pentaurus fighting to get the required pentanium before time runs out. Each player adopts a race with its special characteristics. There are several game modes:


     Pentaurus Black Hole: standard mode.
     Pentaurus Star: beginner mode.
     Pentaurus Black Hole solitaire mode: challenges an artificial intelligence.


Pentaurus: Black Hole is a limited edition (50 units) expansion, handmade in Amphora Games facilities, which is not sold in stores and is only available on the official website and at few festivals.

Name: Pentaurus: Fleet
Description:
Pentaurus: Fleet is composed of a set of 5 ship cards, representing complete fleets of the different races present in the Pentaurus galaxy. Each fleet card has different characteristics that match the playing style and background of your race.

Pentaurus: Fleet is a limited edition (50 units) expansion, handmade in Amphora Games facilities, which is not sold in stores and is only available on the official website and at few festivals.

Name: Onslaught
Description:
You and your fellow comrades are teaming up to fend off the oncoming monsters trying to make their way back into Somberwood Citadel. You and your team have to survive the massing waves as they continue to barrage the gates. Can you survive the Onslaught?

Onslaught is a cooperative tower defense game for 1 to 6 players. Each turn more enemies will spawn, but that's ok because in between waves you can go salvaging to upgrade your turrets to make defending easier. At some point The Maker will send one elite monster, or maybe he will even show up to try to finish the job. If you can stop them then you win and have successfully driven him from his castle!

A turn is comprised of multiple phases. The first phase will have all players adding weapons or support cards to their own personal pillbox. The second phase will have monsters advance, followed by having new monsters arrive. The third phase is fending off all monsters visible. Players, in no particular order, will take turns targeting a monster they wish to shoot. If their roll is successful, they damage the monster according to their weapon. If they miss, nothing happens and another player may shoot. Instead of shooting, a player may support a teammate with one of their shots adding extra accuracy. These steps repeat until the elite monster is defeated causing the players to win, or until a single monster has re-entered the citadel causing the players to lose and have to try again another day.

Name: Bluffen
Description:
Does everyone lay down the card that belongs to the opened symbol? 
Is someone bluffing ?
In that case hit the bell and check the last card...  Are you bluffing then you collect all the cards

He who loses all his cards first wins!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Ancient Root
Description:
Promo gear card that were included with the Pinpup Easter Aya, which is not part of the game.

The Easter Aya kit comes with 2 miniatures. A 54mm scale model perfect for painters and a 35mm scale model for gamers looking for a fun survivor stand-in for their springtime gaming session. It also includes the Ancient Root, a deeply-buried promo gear card.

Easter Aya is packaged in a dazzlingly illustrated box that includes:

1 x 54mm scale, hard plastic Easter Aya (seated)
1 x 35mm scale, hard plastic Easter Aya (standing)
1 x Hard plastic Kingdom Death 50mm base and scenic insert
1 x Hard plastic Kingdom Death 30mm base and scenic insert
Large matte art print
1x Ancient Root promo gear card

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Gibbering Haremite
Description:
Promo vermin resource card that were included with the Easter Pinup Twilight Knight, which is not part of the game.

The Easter Pinup Twilight Knight is a delightful vernal version of the icon Pinup Twilight Knight. In gorgeous new packaging for 2019! Now includes a promo vermin resource to add to your vermin deck.

Enclosed in a handsome new box, the Pinup Easter Twilight Knight includes:

1 x Hard Plastic Pinup Easter Twilight Knight
1 x Hard plastic Kingdom Death 30mm base and scenic insert
Large matte art print
Gibbering Haremite promo vermin resource

Name: Hexerei: the Three Witches of Würzburg
Description:
Hexerei is a 1 vs All game of combat and cooperative maneuvering, set in a broody, war-torn 17th century Germany. Up to four players will play as Hunters tasked with finding and slaying the Three Witches of Würzburg before the opposing player-led Coven completes the Ritual.

Hunters will interrogate Prisoners from the Tribunal Deck to reveal unknown tiles on the gaming board in order to find Arcana Tiles. These allow to draw “leads” from the Arcana Deck and ultimately force the Witches to reveal themselves and fight. Hunters need to act fast, because the Coven will complete the Ritual in 8 turns.

The Coven’s powers are great, but its fight against time is no less dire. The Coven’s player controls each turn’s conditions by drawing from the Orbis Deck and can deal gruesome spells from his Maleficia Deck. He gains power from the Ritual and can summon Creatures. Each of these is based on the darkest German myths and can go toe-to-toe with any Hunter, but at the same time is specialized in a tactical role and could easily be wasted.

The Hunters and the Coven fight for board control: each struggles to mix favorable cards into the decks controlled by the opponent. A streamlined dice combat system favors decisive action, hard choices and risk-taking. Cooperation and resource-pooling is needed between Hunters to secure equipment and plan actions against the Coven. Rash decisions can spell ruin for both sides, since the number of Hunter “lives” are limited, and each Creature can only be summoned once. Each game set will contain original art and (unpainted) miniatures for Witches, Creatures and the Hunters.

-description from designer

Name: Bull Rally
Description:
The stock market draws in investors with dreams of wealth and success — but it often spits them back out with empty pockets. Do you have what it takes to turn a profit?

Bull Rally is a simple, real-time trading game that captures many of the basic concepts and emotions of the stock market.

Over ten trading days, players buy and sell stocks in real time, then update each stock's price on the stock chart based on supply and demand, news reports, and other market conditions. Holding the right stocks at the right time will also earn dividends. The player who earns the most money wins — but anyone who earns a profit is a successful trader!

—description from the designer

Name: The Great Collector
Description:
Game story:
You came into an unprecedented fortune of masterpiece paintings that previously belonged to some of the greatest collectors of the past - King Charles I, Kaiser Rudolf II, Empress Catherine the Great or a true visionary merchant Sergei Shchukin.

Their art heritage was scattered around the world and you now have the chance to make your mark and reunite these collections back again.

Start your hunt for the missing pieces - pave your way through the dark times of history, roll the dice on erratic art market and steal the show from other collectors in the quest for success.

This game is based on real history events that shaped the world of art we live in today. All the artworks involved did truly belong to the main characters at some point of their lives.

Gameplay:
The gameplay is about creating your own strategy on the way to reassemble one of the greatest art collections of the past and preventing others from being the first to achieve that.

It simulates the turbulent art market with auction bidding, dealer and gallery sales, organising exhibitions and even bluffing when the stakes are high. Various historic and art market events - from maniacs to revolutions - can dramatically change the flow of the game.

To acquire new pieces for the collection you would obviously need some cash. And there are numerous ways to earn some by setting up thematic shows and selling artworks strategically. However, money only won't get you to the top. You have to level up your collector's skills to become the next Great Collector. This will widen your choices and give you a fair advantage on the market.

—description from the designer

Name: フラクション･ポーカー (Fraction Poker)
Description:
ãƒ•ãƒ©ã‚¯ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ï½¥ãƒãƒ¼ã‚«ãƒ¼ (Fraction Poker) is a card game where players use a deck of cards with fractions on them (e.g. 1/2, 5/9, 5/3) to form integers.

Players start with a hand of cards and on their turn will select one from a pool face up on the table.  When a player can form an integer with the cards in their hand, they play the cards and earn points equal to the integer formed multiplied by the number of cards used.

The victory point chips show divisions of eighths on them, and players can earn additional points through combining these fractional points into further integers. (e.g. 2 points and 6 points can be viewed as 2/8 and 6/8 and together make 8/8, so an additional point is earned.)  The game ends when the victory chips or cards are gone, and the player with the most points wins.

Name: Doubt
Description:
The year is 1972. The Cold War continues to strain international relations between NATO allies and the Soviet Union. Your Spymaster suspects that the enemy has compromised operatives within your organization. Find the enemy spies!

At game start, players draw international location cards from the location deck. Choose one as your secret hideout, and leave the rest facedown in the center of the table as false leads. Be the first one to correctly identify the opponent’s true secret locations without being eliminated.

Each round, players pick a card from the intel deck and use it to investigate a hideout. The player who is associated with the hideout location must truthfully confirm or deny whether the intel describes the hideout location correctly. Through deduction, the false hideouts can be identified by piecing the clues together.

Be careful! Each time you investigate a false hideout, you increase the chance of being exposed… and eliminated!

-description from designer

Name: Envyra: 5 Player Expansion
Description:
Expansion allows Envyra to be played by 5 players.

CONTENT: 1 Player Shield, 1 Player Board (Grid), 5 Wooden Cubes, 5 Tiles

SETUP & RULES (for 5 Player game):
Before you start, prior setup, mix Tiles from this expansion with Tiles from the base game. Do not remove any tiles during setup. Use Playing Grid like in 4 Player game (full 3x4 grid). 
Rules for 5 player game are the same as with other player counts.

If you use Equilibrium expansion in 5 player game, we recommend not to use 4 Points Equilibrium cards (displaying 3 Elements).

Name: キュービズム (Qubism)
Description:
A two-player abstract strategy game where the goal is to move your pawn to the other player's starting row.  Cubes with arrows act as obstacles.

On a player's turn they may either move their pawn orthogonally once space (including backwards); place a cube onto the board (with restrictions on the placement of the arrow); or move a cube that is present and rotate it.

Name: Chiangmai Checkers
Description:
A two-player abstract strategy game, reputedly originating from Chiangmai, Thailand, where it is said to be called Mhark Nheeb.

Players take turns to move one of their 8 marbles, which initially start on the back row of an 8×8 grid, any number of spaces in a horizontal or vertical direction.

Opposing marbles can be captures in one of two ways - enclosing or balancing.

Enclosing captures are made by moving a marble so as to trap one or more opposing marbles between the marble just moved and a pre-existing friendly marble, in an unbroken straight line, horizontally or vertically.  The trapped marbles are removed from the board.

Balancing captures occur when a player moves a marble directly in between two opponents, one on either side in a vertical or horizontal direction, upon which the two opposing marbles are removed from the board.

(The rules in my possession do not state that captures are compulsory, nor do they suggest that any number other than 2 opposing marbles can be captured by balancing.  Examples of enclosing captures of 1 or 2 opposing marbles are shown, from which I infer that any number (up to 6) opposing marbles may be captured in this way).

When a player is reduced to a single marble, he or she loses the game, unless he/she can WIN it with the very next move.

(The rules in my possession do not state what happens if a player is reduced from 2 or more down to zero moves in a single capture, but the implication is that this player immediately loses the game).

Name: This Game Is A DISASTER
Description:
The people of Earth were shocked to find out climate change was not a hoax. If one disaster hit them they may have been prepared, but what happens when all the disasters hit at the same time?

This Game Is A Disaster is a very uncooperative card game where each of the 2-6 players take an equal part of the deck with each card representing one of their disaster survivors. The players take turns playing cards that recreate familiar scenes from disaster movies - giant tsunamis, impromptu volcanoes, and sometimes sharks! The goal is destroy all opponents' cards and to be the last player with cards left.

A central part of "Disaster" is the shared discard pile, known as the Destroyed Pile. Players lose cards to this central pile but can play cards to retrieve as well, representing the reunions and other bright spots that appear in disaster movies.

This Game Is A Disaster is a fast and fun game that is as ridiculous as it is severe.

—description from the designer

Name: Zoomate
Description:
In Zoomate, the country of fire and the country of water — rivals who recently conducted a worldwide conflict — are in an uneasy peace thanks to a neutral third party that wants to wield power in order to maintain that peace.

Unfortunately, the central power plant has been hacked, and now all three parties are grabbing for whatever power they can in order to bring victory to their side or (in the case of the third party) lock in a permanent stalemate between fire and water. If fire or water gain control of three or more power switches by the end of the fifth turn, then they win; if neither does by game's end, then the neutral party has preserved peace and won.

Name: Combat Veteran: Bonus Scenario
Description: Modern War #32, Nov-Dec 2017 provides 52 bonus counters for Modern War #31 - Combat Veteran.  Rules and Bonus Scenarios specific to the additional counters are provided in a PDF online.  The Rules add 3 pages with 1 additional page covering 2 Scenarios.  The primary addition of the Rules/Scenarios/Counters are vehicles, which were not present in the original Combat Veteran.

Name: メトロックス (MetroX): Ishikawa Promo Map
Description:
In MetroX, players create subway networks by filling in the station spaces on their individual game sheets. Using the numbers revealed by the cards, all players fill up their subway map with â—¯s in the station spaces. However, the number of times they can add stations to each line is limited, so they have to make tough choices. Players can score many points by getting their star bonuses in stations with many intersecting routes. Players also get bonuses by being the first to complete routes. Try to fill in all your stations to minimize the penalties and achieve a high score!

ãƒ¡ãƒˆãƒ­ãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¹ (MetroX): Ishikawa Promo Map was released for the 2018 Kanazawa Board Game Market. It consists in one simple map to use with MetroX's standard rules.

Name: DropMix: Playlist Pack (Phase)
Description:
Comes with 15 DropMix cards plus 1 hidden track card.

This playlist includes music from: Axwell /\ Ingrosso, Paul Van Dyk, Jamie xx and Bastille.

Theme: Dance/Electronic

Name: DropMix: Playlist Pack (Rhymer)
Description:
Comes with 15 DropMix cards plus 1 hidden track card.

This playlist includes music from: Mac Miller, Fetty Wap, ScHoolboy Q and D'Von Riice.

Theme: Hip-Hop/Rap

Name: Strandjutters
Description:
It is storming!
Unexpected technical problems, sandbanks and the rough sea capsize the large cargo ship. The goods are discarded into the ocean and are floating onto the beach.
Curious beach combers gather on the beach.
Which beach comber collects the biggest loot?

Gameplay:
The players are rolling two special dices included in the game. The first one decides in which directions the loot is drifting: first horizontally then vertically. A small triangle marks the horizontal direction. 
The second dice decides how many steps a beach comber can move. Until loot landed on one of the sandbanks, the comber can only move horizontally. As soon as loot has stranded somewhere all combers can move directly into the direction of the loot and collect it by just moving onto the sandbank. If there are moves left, the loot can be picked up and the comber is able to move the rest of the moves back to the beach to save the goods.
A beach comber collects all goods on the sandbank which she/he landed on.

—user summary

Name: Great Siege of Malta: Battle for St Elmo
Description:
The year is 1565 and on a tiny island in the Mediterranean, a small garrison of Knights of St John and Maltese within Fort St Elmo face off against a massive invading force of Ottomans under their supreme naval commander, Piyale Pasha. With control of the Mediterranean as the ultimate prize, will the Knights hold out long enough for relief to arrive from Sicily or will the Pasha succeed in a stunning show of military strength?
The stage is set for the greatest siege in European history.

The Great Siege of Malta is a wargame in two parts. Part 1: the Battle for St Elmo -  where players can re-explore the strategies and events of the famous battle; and Part 2: the Siege of Senglea (scheduled for a 2021 release) which can uniquely be combined with part 1 (the boards will fit together) for a tabletop siege of truly epic proportions.

Both games use tokens and/or miniatures to represent the different military units available, on a gameboard presenting a detailed tactical map of the famous locations. The game offers tactical versatility within a simple ruleset that guarantees quick play. A combination of dice and card driven gameplay with a special Command Dice mechanism forces the players to think carefully which military units they will trigger for the round based on the limited available commanders. Combat dice then resolve the outcome of each attack while giving players opportunities to influence the outcomes through card play.

Game rounds represent single days of the siege with the two commanders having opportunities to manipulate their troops and play additional thematically rich special cards. The game can be played as a 'recreation of history' with known events occurring in certain rounds or as a more freeform 'what if' style of game that allows players on both sides to experiment with different strategies. Winning the game is not about destroying the enemy but instead focuses more on the balance of morale between the two  opposing forces. Use superior tactics and brave challenges to improve your own morale or undermine the enemy and grab the victory!

The game is as historically accurate as we can make it. BadCatGames has worked closely with academic experts to ensure the game gives players an exciting opportunity to relive this most famous moment in european history in all its detail. Siege of Malta also presents the facts of history as they stand. The game does not take sides in any way and does not glorify either of the forces involved to the detriment of the other. The wargame is simply a gripping and thematic educational opportunity to experience this greatest of sieges.

—description from the publisher

Name: くだものがたり (Fruitale)
Description:
In the flip-and-write game Fruitale, a.k.a. ãã ã‚‚ã®ãŒãŸã‚Š, the players, as fruit farm owners, grow tasty fruits and deliver them to market along with jam and honey to establish their farms.

First, two cards are flipped in the cultivation phase. Players can choose to either take the fruits shown, or take honey instead. This process continues until the full 12 weeks have been played.

In the harvest phase, players deliver their honey, sell their surplus fruits, and find out which fruits grew well enough to sell.

Finally, in the sales calculation phase, players add their scores. Whoever has sold the highest value of produce wins.

—user summary

Name: Sea Cube
