Description: Sea Cube is a treasure hunt game in which you seek and describe where treasures (six colored dice) lie in a box that looks like the sea. One player looks into the box through one of four periscopes and describes the locations of treasures to other players, either their team or the entire group if playing a full co-op. Teammates then mark the location and type of treasure on a map. The team with the most points wins.

Name: The Search for the Northwest Passage
Description:
From Wikipedia: In 1845 a lavishly equipped two-ship expedition led by Sir John Franklin sailed to the Canadian Arctic to chart the last unknown swaths of the Northwest Passage. Confidence was high, as they estimated there was less than 500 km (310 mi) remaining of unexplored Arctic mainland coast. When the ships failed to return, relief expeditions and search parties explored the Canadian Arctic, which resulted in a thorough charting of the region, along with a possible passage. Many artifacts from the expedition were found over the next century and a half, including notes that the ships were ice-locked in 1846 near King William Island, about halfway through the passage, and unable to break free. You need to do better!

In The Search for the Northwest Passage you'll try to find a sea route from mid-19th century Britain to the Pacific Ocean via the Canadian Arctic Archipelago, make discoveries along the way, and return home to tell the story.

On a player's turn, he/she has a choice of two actions. He announces whether he wants to navigate or explore. Then he draws the top card of the deck. Players alternate turns until one of the end game conditions occurs. The player with the most VPs wins the game.

Name: Cthulhu Wars: Daemon Sultan
Description:
The Daemon Sultan Faction box includes 3 Great Old Ones, 6 Monsters (Great Old Ones Larvae), 3 Chaos Gates, a high priest, a dark demon, six acolytes, and four brain cylinder minis, as well as four token brain cylinders.

Great Old Ones
Unique among Factions, the Daemon Sultan has THREE Great Old Ones! They are its avatars: Thesis, Antithesis, and Synthesis. Each is distinct, yet all are linked, bound  inextricably by interlocking costs, abilities, and spellbooks.

Monsters
Each Great Old One has a Larval Form! These have a Combat 2 if their parent Great Old One is in play, and O Combat otherwise. They are required to Awaken their parent.

Chaos Gates
Only Cultists of the insane Daemon Sultan Faction may control these terrifying constructs, which can displace and destroy ordinary Gates.

The Daemon Sultan starts with no units on the map. All Daemon Sultan Spellbooks are one-use per full Action Phase, like the core game's Thousand Forms Spellbook. You must orchestrate their best use.

Languages
Although no separate German and French versions will exist, a full translation kit exists for French (also includes the Cthulhu Wars: Bubastis material).

Add-ons:

     Brown Daemon Sultan battle dice
     Neutral unit identifier rings

Name: Cholent, The Game!: Cholent, the Expansion!
Description:
What's the only thing better than Cholent? More Cholent!
Cholent, the Expansion includes a brand new Mazel deck, making the game more wild than ever! You've played the game. Now try it with a bit of Mazel on your side.

—description from the publisher

Name: Duelo de Poderes
Description:
In this fast-paced speed game, players are competing in real time.

In each round, players try to use their assigned Polyomino tiles to fully fill their tableau as fast as they can.

The game is all about a competition and at the same time building an individual tableau, so as to get the chance to remove gems from other players or getting back previously lost gems.
If you lose your last gem then you are eliminated from the game!

Winner is the last player standing, or whoever has the most stones at the end of round 33, whatever happens first.

Name: Anderson-Cottonwood-Opoly
Description:
HOW DO YOU MAKE A GAME ABOUT THE GREAT CITIES OF ANDERSON-COTTONWOOD, CA? While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed all the Anderson-Cottonwood we could into this box. It’s full of outdoor adventures, family attractions, rich traditions and of course...an exquisite park right in between - a little something for everybody! Looking for a fun way to experience the Shasta Cascade?

HERE’S A QUICK IDEA OF HOW TO PLAY! Buy your favorite Anderson-Cottonwood properties, increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams, property tax and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun! GET YOUR GAME ON!

So choose your token and advance to GO ANDERSON-COTTONWOOD! You may soon be the Mayor… or out of the game for eating too many omelets from Becca’s Café! THIS IS ANDERSON-COTTONWOOD.... AND IT’S YOUR ROLL!

-description from designer

Name: Clearlake-Opoly
Description:
HOW DO YOU MAKE A GAME ABOUT THE GREAT CITY OF CLEARLAKE, CALIFORNIA? While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed all the Clearlake we could into this box. It’s full of outdoor adventures, family attractions, rich traditions and of course...the legendary lake itself -a little something for every Clearlaker! Looking for a fun way to experience the small town with a big heart?

HERE’S A QUICK IDEA OF HOW TO PLAY! Buy your favorite Clearlake properties, increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams, property tax and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun! GET YOUR GAME ON!

So choose your token and advance to GO CLEARLAKE! You may soon be the Mayor…or out of the game for eating too many salmon burritos from the Cactus Grill! THIS IS CLEARLAKE.... AND IT’S YOUR ROLL!

-description from designer

Name: Crescent City-Opoly
Description:
HOW DO YOU MAKE A GAME ABOUT THE GREAT CITY OF CRESCENT CITY, CA? While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed all the Crescent City we could into this box. It’s full of outdoor adventures, family attractions, rich traditions and of course...an old, historic lighthouse - a little something for everybody! Looking for a fun way to experience Land’s End?

HERE’S A QUICK IDEA OF HOW TO PLAY! Buy your favorite Crescent City properties, increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams, property tax and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun! GET YOUR GAME ON!

So choose your token and advance to GO CRESCENT CITY! You may soon be the Mayor… or out of the game for eating too many pizzas from SeaQuake Brewing! THIS IS CRESCENT CITY.... AND IT’S YOUR ROLL!

-description from designer

Name: Mbrane
Description:
A modern, compact, territory-control strategy game with no elements of chance.  "Minutes to learn, a lifetime to master"

The game is played on a standard 9x9 sudoku board, using integers 0 through 8.

Players take turns placing integer under the standard sudoku rules of placement; each number can occur only once in each row, column, and 3x3 region.  The game ends when no more tiles can be placed, or both players agree to resolve the gameboard.

Placing tiles give the player "power" in the regions containing the tile.  This power is equivalent to the integer value.

Additionally, if the tiles are in a cell that touches an external region, either diagonally or orthogonally (rows/columns), the player receives "influence" equal to 1/2 tile value in each connected external region.

The general goal is to control a majority of regions at the end of play.

In simplified versions, the points are totaled for each region, both power and influence, and the player with the most points in a given region is said to have control.

In the advanced game, a cascade known as Resolution occurs.  (For more info on the advanced game, see http://mbranegame.com/rules-of-m/)


The game is available on the App Store and Google Play—apps are free, ad-free, purchase free and collect no user data:

https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/mbrane/id1232076299
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=mclass.com.mabstract

The game can also be played on Steven Taverner's AI AI:

http://mrraow.com/index.php/aiai-home/

Name: 公国のペレストロイカ (Koukoku no Peresutoroika)
カラフルピラミッド (Colorful Pyramid)
ケーキをつくろう (Let's Make A Cake)
Description:
Publisher's summary
ã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚­ã‚’ã¤ãã‚ã† (KÄ“ki o tsukurou) (Let's Make A Cake) is a children's game from Japan.

Players bake some cakes, and the player who bakes the most delicious cake is the winner. A delicious cake is one that either has all the same fruit on the cake, or all different fruits on the cake.

Players pick fruits from a bag and put them on their cakes. When putting fruit on the cake, you should look at the cakes the other players are making. You can try to work out which fruits are more likely to come out of the bag, by seeing what has already been made. This will help you win!

This game is made for children from 6 years up, younger children can play if someone helps with the scoring. In fact, even five-year-olds were playing in the test play, it was very exciting.

Name: Nu går vi på video
Description:
The name of this Swedish film trivia game translates as "Let's go to the videos". Released by a Swedish video distribution company in collaboration with Target Games, it may have been used in some promotional context, but the game itself doesn't contain any specific promotional material.

Gameplay consists mostly of answering trivia questions about films or TV shows, or related topics such as actors or source material. Each question card has questions at three nominal difficulty levels, and answering a question correctly allows a player to move along a track towards the goal by rolling a 4-, 6- or 8-sided die. Some spaces mean a player instead has to mime a movie title for the other players to guess.

—user summary

Name: Castle Panic: Big Box
Description:
Castle Panic is a cooperative, light strategy game for 1 to 6 players ages 10 and up. Players must work together to defend their castle, in the center of the board, from monsters that attack out of the forest at the edges of the board. Players trade cards, hit and slay monsters, and plan strategies together to keep their castle towers intact. The players either win or lose together, but only the player with the most victory points is declared the Master Slayer. Players must balance the survival of the group with their own desire to win.

To celebrate the ten-year anniversary, Fireside Games is releasing the Castle Panic Big Box. This extra-large box will contain the original Castle Panic game as well as all three expansions; The Wizard’s Tower, The Dark Titan, and Engines of War. For the first time ever, fans both new and old will be able to get the core game and all the expansions together in one box.

Castle Panic Big Box will also include seven promotional game cards and five promotional Tower tokens, one of which has never been available before 2019. Players will also find an updated, comprehensive rulebook that covers the rules for the base game and all three expansions. The insert for the box has a space for all the game pieces and provides a handy way to organize everything players need.

—description from the publisher
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games
